title: Taiwan Dengue Cases Analysis
text:
Hello! We are Group 12, nice to meet you üòä


Taiwan Dengue Cases Analysis
Dengue fever has been a pressing public health concern and was documented to have a ten-fold surge worldwide from 2000 to 2019 (World Health Organisation, 2023). It is spread by mosquitoes and are generally more common tropical regions, including places such as Taiwan and Singapore. Taiwan‚Äôs historical dengue cases data presents a good opportunity to analyze long-term trends and seasonal outbreaks. Useful insights can potentially be discovered to better understand and predict these incidences.
Our project aims to:

Develop interactive visualizations to illustrate the temporal trends in dengue cases across the years, seasons and geographic locations in Taiwan
Perform time series forecasting to forecast future dengue cases based on past trends, and evaluate the accuracy of different forecasting models
Conduct correlation analysis of dengue cases with external factors



Meet The Team
Zanelle Lee Wenfang

Chua Jia Peng

title: About
text:
About this site
My team comprise of JP and Me.
HI - JP HERE

title: Project Proposal
text:
Motivation
Dengue fever has been a pressing public health concern and was documented to have a ten-fold surge worldwide from 2000 to 2019 (World Health Organisation, 2023). It is spread by mosquitoes and are generally more common tropical regions, including places such as Taiwan and Singapore. Taiwan‚Äôs historical dengue cases data presents a good opportunity to analyze long-term trends and seasonal outbreaks. Useful insights can potentially be discovered to better understand and predict these incidences.
Our project aims to:

Develop interactive visualizations to illustrate the temporal trends in dengue cases across the years, seasons and geographic locations in Taiwan
Perform time series forecasting to forecast future dengue cases based on past trends, and evaluate the accuracy of different forecasting models
Conduct correlation analysis of dengue cases with external factors



Data Source
For this project, the Taiwan Dengue Cases 1998-2024 dataset will be used.
The dataset is retrieved from Kaggle.


Problems / Issues the project will address
Dengue cases often fluctuate due to seasonal changes. Our project aims to identify key drivers of dengue outbreaks and raise public awareness.
Additionally, by leveraging time series forecasting models, we can determine the most suitable model for predicting dengue outbreaks. This enables stakeholders to take proactive rather than reactive measures in response to potential outbreaks.


Relevant Related Work
On Kaggle, a basic EDA, correlation analysis and predictive modelling have been performed using this dataset:

Exploring Dengue Fever Cases in Taiwan: A Data-Driven Approach

We also identified 2 research papers related to the study of dengue cases that could potentially be useful for our project:

Prediction of annual dengue incidence by hydro-climatic extremes for southern Taiwan
Temporal patterns of dengue epidemics: The case of recent outbreaks in Kaohsiung



Proposed Approach

Load the relevant R packages
Additional datasets, such as rainfall and temperature of Taiwan, might be required
Data cleaning and creating additional relevant features
EDA
Correlation analysis
Time series analysis
Time series forecasting
Build Shiny dashboard for interactive visualization

The group will be working on tasks 1-4 together and will split up to work on tasks 5-8.


Prototypes / Story Boards

title: Minutes of Meeting 3
text:
Meeting Attendance

Chua Jia Peng
Zanelle Lee Wenfang

title: Minutes of Meeting 3
text:
Issues/Discussions

The team discussed the next steps to be done following Prof Kam‚Äôs feedback on the proposal.


Data Source

Prof Kam suggested for the original dataset to be downloaded, instead of using the Kaggle‚Äôs version. Both team members tried to download the datasets given from the source link but only managed to download the Dengue_Daily.csv file. An email was set to Prof Kam to request for his copy of the data sets instead.



Review of geospatial knowledge needed

Prof Kam mentioned that more knowledge (not covered in class) would be required to complete the analysis of the chosen dataset. The notes from Geospatial Analysis were reviewed by both team members together. It was accepted that the additional information might be too much to be mastered within the remaining two weeks.
Zanelle suggested that perhaps more work could be done with the data that did not involve the geospatial segment but realised that there might be limited columns to work with (age, gender, number of dengue cases).
Jia Peng highlighted that there would also be significant effort required in the data wrangling segment before being able to be used for analysis. She would also try to get a head start on the preparation and cleaning of the data. It was agreed that a consultation with Prof Kam was required, and was set to be on 19 March, 8.30am-9.30am.



Actions to be done on the data

The team members reviewed the proposal plan together. While pending Prof Kam‚Äôs advice for the feasibility of the project, Jia Peng suggested the team could split the analysis segment. She volunteered to attempt the correlation analysis, and for Zanelle to attempt the time series segment. Both segments could be completed without necessarily involving the geospatial segment of the dataset.



Conclusion

The team has decided to perform data cleaning and some EDA individually before meeting with Prof Kam. Manual visual look through of the dataset will also allow the team to decide on the dataset to be filtered, if relevant.
The team will reconvene on 19th March with Prof Kam.



Items to Discuss for Consultation

Filtering away columns that have many empty values?
Is it better to keep only the most recent 5-10 years data?
Feasibility of using this dataset due to lack of geospatial analytics knowledge?

title: Minutes of Meeting 1
text:
Meeting Attendance

Chua Jia Peng
Zanelle Lee Wenfang

title: Minutes of Meeting 1
text:
Issues/Discussions

Discussion on project dataset

The team shared their thoughts about the possible data sources that Prof Kam shared on the project brief.



Discovering State of Learning with PISA 2022

The team shared that this is an interesting topic and can explore further with actual datasets.



Be Weatherwise of Otherwise

Jia Peng shared that the sample project shared by Prof Kam is of a similar topic, and it might be hard to think of other approaches for this project.
Zanelle mentioned that we could find historical weather data from other countries instead.



Discovering State of Economic with open Government Data and Nowcasting methods

The team shared that this topic is unfamiliar to all and may require additional research before proceeding with the project proposal. This is the least preferred topic.¬†



Other sources

The team may look for possible datasets from Kaggle and Singapore‚Äôs open data portal.
The team will each shortlist 3 possible datasets and reconvene on 1 March at 4pm, to finalise 1 dataset for the project proposal.

title: Minutes of Meeting 2
text:
Meeting Attendance

Chua Jia Peng
Zanelle Lee Wenfang

title: Minutes of Meeting 2
text:
Issues/Discussions

Confirmation on project dataset

The team shared their thoughts about the possible data for the project



Taiwan Dengue Cases 1998 ‚Äì 2024

Possible EDA can be conducted to view historical trend, correlation between variables. Time series analysis and forecasting can be performed on the dataset as well.
Zanelle identified potential columns that can be excluded due to too many ‚ÄúNone‚Äù values which will not be meaningful for the analysis.
Additional dataset, such as precipitation and temperature by regions in Taiwan, may be helpful in the analysis as they could be correlated with dengue. The team will source for these information.



Workout & Fitness Tracker Dataset

There is sufficient data for analysis and for building a regression model to recommend workout plans, and assess the impact of workout, sleep and nutrition.
However, the dataset appears synthetic and inaccurate. For example, the recorded water intake for all users is 1.9L. User 9 reportedly ran 13.24 km in 25 minutes, which is faster than the estimated speed of the fastest runner which seems unrealistic, and yet this is classified as a low-intensity workout.



Quality of Life Index by Country

A possible topic to explore with this dataset is suggesting destinations for relocation. However, the sample size available is very small to work with to potentially provide useful insights, and there is no further breakdown to track the progression of quality of life over time.



Conclusion

The team has decided to proceed with the Taiwan Dengue Cases 1998 ‚Äì 2024 dataset.
The team will perform data cleaning and some EDA individually. The team will also look for dataset on Taiwan‚Äôs precipitation and temperature by regions.
The team will reconvene after 9th March.

title: Data Preparation
text:
The following R packages will be required:

pacman::p_load(tidyverse,plotly)

title: Data Preparation
text:
2.1 Filter Past 10 Years‚Äô Data
By Onset_Date
Recent 12 years - 2013 to 2024

dengue_10yrs <- dengue_daily[dengue_daily$Onset_Date >= as.Date("1988-01-01") & dengue_daily$Onset_Date <= as.Date("2024-12-31"), ]
